question: What are common symptoms in female carriers of DMD?
ideal_answer: Female carriers of Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD) may experience muscle weakness and cardiomyopathy. Common symptoms include pseudohypertrophy of calf muscles, muscular weakness, compensatory movements, and longer timed performance on functional tasks. Some female carriers may also present with asymmetrical muscle weakness.

snippets.text: 8% of female DMD carriers have muscle weakness and cardiomyopathy.
Pseudohypertrophy of calf muscles, muscular weakness, compensatory movements and longer timed performance on functional tasks were observed in most of the cases.

Clinical manifestation of asymmetrical muscle weakness and compensatory movements, or both can be found in female carriers of DMD mutations, which can adversely affect posture and functional performance of these patients.

The symptomatic females shared mild but progressive muscular weakness and increased serum creatin kinase (CK) levels.
Approximately 8% of female Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) carriers are manifesting carriers and have muscle weakness to some extent.
Two to 20% of female heterozygotes with a P/LP variant develop symptoms of dystrophinopathy ranging from mild muscle weakness to significant disability similar to Becker muscular dystrophy.
Female carriers of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) presenting with DMD symptomology similar to males with DMD, such as skeletal muscle weakness and cardiomyopathy, are termed manifesting carriers.

Female carriers of mutations in the dystrophin gene (DMD-carriers) may manifest clinically in the skeletal muscle, the heart, or both.
Cardiomyopathy is sometimes the only clinical symptom in female carriers of DMD.
Cardiomyopathy is common and often prevalent at similar frequency in female DMD carriers irrespective of whether they manifest skeletal muscle disease.
Female carriers of DMD gene mutations may be symptomatic and show variable skeletal as well as cardiac muscle symptoms.

Our findings show abnormal muscle energy metabolism in DMD/BMD female carriers.
DMD/BMD female carriers are usually asymptomatic, although about 8 % may exhibit muscle or cardiac symptoms.
